snippet: The so-called rebates that stock exchanges pay Wall Street firms could give those firms an incentive to profit at the expense of investors, Nathaniel Popper reports in The New York Times.
abstract: The so-called rebates that stock exchanges pay Wall Street firms could give those firms an incentive to profit at the expense of investors, Nathaniel Popper reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Study Says Broker Rebates Cost Investors Billions
